intro: Psychotria sekharanae, commonly known as the Sri Lankan Psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to the island of Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria sekharanae is not widely studied, but it contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
